question: According to BCCI, this test is mandatory for cricketers to pass the endurance test.
explanation: In a bid to make India Cricket team one of the fittest sides in world cricket, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has made it mandatory for cricketers to pass the 'yo-yo' endurance test. This test is widely used by selection bodies in various sports including hockey, football and cricket. In a yo-yo test, players have to pace themselves to and fro between two rows of cones kept 20 metres apart. For every round the player has to sync his sprint with the beeps that are played.
